question.para: Which packages are needed in a Windows system before installing ADA?

answer.para: ADA needs some extra programs installed in your computer in order to work properly. The toolkit is installed using the version control system git. The minimum required packages to install (with their correspondign dependencies) are:

listitem.para: git: Fast version control system used to download the latest ADA version.
python-lxml: Python bindings for libxml2 and libxslt libraries.
python-libxml2: Python bindings for the GNOME XML library.
docbook-xsl: XSL stylesheets to process DocBook.
openssh-client: SSH client program to connect to remote sites.

question.para: ADA takes a huge amount of time to process Docbook documents, why?

answer.para: The symptoms for this problem is an unusually large amount of time for the toolkit to process a Docbook file. The process eventually finishes, but it takes for ever (in the order of minutes to process one or two files).

The stylesheets in ADA import a set of default stylesheets to process most of the Docbook constructs. The location of these styleheets may vary from machine to machine. The way to solve this problem is using XML Catalogs. A catalog is a file specific for a single machine that specifies the location where certain files are installed. If this catalog is not properly deployed, xsltproc (the XSLT processor used by ADA) obtaines them all from the web. The number of stylesheets is high and therefore, processing time goes through the roof.
Te solution for this problem is to make sure the packages specified in are properly installed.
